conversation_summary:
Room 333, Aetheria Suite: two beds, venetian-blind bars striping dusk across cream walls.
Dress gone from closet, only wire hangers left swaying.
Return slip signed, hotel phone cradled, keys heavy in palm.
Qualiatik barefoot on carpet, tote bag packed, humming Tara’s name like a shutter click.
Window frames the hatchback three decks below, streetlights stringing a clear path home through indigo stillness.
